paragraphs.text:
%md
## Selecting a wine to bring to a party that is likley to be good and is also inexpensive!
### We've all been there.   We are invited to a party and want to bring something to contribute.   A bottle of wine is always a good option.   But which one?   There are so many!   And we don't want to break the bank for our party gift.   Let's try to use the Autonomous Database and Oracle Machine Learning to find a likely tasty and likely to be rated greater than 90 Points (GT_90_Points) adult beverage that is also affordable (Under $30).  
##### Original data comes from Kaggle WineReviews130K data = 130k wine reviews with variety, location, winery, price, and description etc. Points was binned to GT_90 and LT_90 <https://www.kaggle.com/zynicide/wine-reviews>  
#### Updated: October 2020, Authors:  Charlie Berger, Dhvani Sheth, Siddesh Ujini

msg.data:
Selecting a wine to bring to a party that is likley to be good and is also inexpensive!

We've all been there. We are invited to a party and want to bring something to contribute. A bottle of wine is always a good option. But which one? There are so many! And we don't want to break the bank for our party gift. Let's try to use the Autonomous Database and Oracle Machine Learning to find a likely tasty and likely to be rated greater than 90 Points (GT_90_Points) adult beverage that is also affordable (Under $30).

Original data comes from Kaggle WineReviews130K data = 130k wine reviews with variety, location, winery, price, and description etc. Points was binned to GT_90 and LT_90 https://www.kaggle.com/zynicide/wine-reviews

Updated: October 2020, Authors: Charlie Berger, Dhvani Sheth, Siddesh Ujini

##### 4. Build a Machine Learning Model to Predict Good Wines to Buy
##### 5. Save our results and further investigage our wine findings using the Oracle Analytics Cloud

msg.data:
1. Explore the data
2. Define the Target Attribute (GT_90_Points vs. LT_90_Points)
3. Find the Key Attributes that Most Influence GT_90_Points_Bin)
4. Build a Machine Learning Model to Predict Good Wines to Buy
5. Save our results and further investigage our wine findings using the Oracle Analytics Cloud

paragraphs.text:
%md
## Business Problem

#### Based on previous wine reviews and data about price, province, variety and other wine attributes, build a predictive model to identify wines most likely to have points > 90.

msg.data:
Business Problem

Based on previous wine reviews and data about price, province, variety and other wine attributes, build a predictive model to identify wines most likely to have points > 90.

paragraphs.text:
%md
## Data Preparation

msg.data: Data Preparation

paragraphs.title: Add POINTS_BIN column
paragraphs.text:
%sql
ALTER TABLE WineReviews130K_bin ADD POINTS_BIN VARCHAR2(15);

paragraphs.title: Populate POINTS_BIN column as Greater than 90 points and Less than 90 points
paragraphs.text:
%script

UPDATE WineReviews130K_bin
SET POINTS_BIN = 'GT_90_Points'
WHERE EXISTS (SELECT WINEREVIEWS130KTEXT.ID
        FROM OMLUSER.WINEREVIEWS130KTEXT
        WHERE WINEREVIEWS130KTEXT.POINTS >= 90 and WINEREVIEWS130KTEXT.ID = WineReviews130K_bin.ID);

UPDATE WineReviews130K_bin
SET POINTS_BIN = 'LT_90_Points'
WHERE EXISTS (SELECT WINEREVIEWS130KTEXT.ID
        FROM OMLUSER.WINEREVIEWS130KTEXT
        WHERE WINEREVIEWS130KTEXT.POINTS < 90 and WINEREVIEWS130KTEXT.ID = WineReviews130K_bin.ID);

%sql
select * from WineReviews130K_bin;

paragraphs.title: Compare Wines from Different Countries
paragraphs.text:
%sql

-- Compare wines from Different Countries
-- Hint: Choose different countries from the drop down

SELECT * FROM WineReviews130K_bin WHERE COUNTRY = ${COUNTRY='Germany', 'Germany'|'Spain'|'Chile'|'US'|'Argentine'|'Italy'|'Australia'};

125642	Australia	The Stump Jump	88	11	South Australia	McLaren Vale		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	D'Arenberg 2007 The Stump Jump White (McLaren Vale)	White Blend	D'Arenberg	LT_90_Points	It's almost two-thirds Riesling, which gives the wine its tight focus and strong mineral and citrus overtones, but there's also Sauvignon Blanc, Marsanne, Viognier and Chardonnay in the mix, giving it layers of fruity complexity. Awfully good for the price.
92017	Australia		85	20	South Australia	Adelaide Hills		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Hill of Content 2005 Pinot Noir (Adelaide Hills)	Pinot Noir	Hill of Content	LT_90_Points	Despite a slightly bitter edge to its raspberry and charred-oak flavors, this medium-bodied Pinot Noir delivers plenty of pleasure. It's a soft, medium-bodied Pinot with nuances of brown sugar and coffee and a persistent finish. Ready to drink now.
125120	Australia	Gulf Station	86	20	Victoria	Yarra Valley		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	De Bortoli 2010 Gulf Station Pinot Noir (Yarra Valley)	Pinot Noir	De Bortoli	LT_90_Points	Suitably light in body and elegant, this is a pretty, varietally correct Pinot Noir, with fruity notes of cranberry and tart cherry accented by shadings of earth and brown sugar. It's silky on the finish, with delicate hints of coffee. Drink now.
19209	Australia	The Y Series	86	12	South Australia	South Australia		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Yalumba 2007 The Y Series Sauvignon Blanc (South Australia)	Sauvignon Blanc	Yalumba	LT_90_Points	Dry, lean and tight, this is a crisply mineral Sauvignon Blanc that manges to avoid any sense of grassiness or overly herbal notes, instead focusing on a narrow range of fruit flavors: green apple, lime and grapefruit. Fine as an ap??ritif or with light seafood dishes. Drink now.
125132	Australia		86	20	Victoria	Yarra Valley		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Innocent Bystander 2010 Pinot Noir (Yarra Valley)	Pinot Noir	Innocent Bystander	LT_90_Points	A lightweight but charming Pinot Noir, with pretty cherry fruit accented by notes of dried bracken and ground cinnamon. It's soft, silky and immediately accessible. Drink now.
125427	Australia	H.D. II	89	95	Victoria	Heathcote		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Heathcote Estate 2006 H.D. II Shiraz (Heathcote)	Shiraz	Heathcote Estate	LT_90_Points	Like Spinal Tap, this wine turns the volume up to 11, packing in enough blueberry jam for breakfast on the Queen Mary II and enough cedary oak to build 100 saunas. It's undeniably powerful and intense, and embued with a lush, creamy texture; the only question is how it will evolve. Drink it now and stand your hair on end.
125435	Australia	Drought Reserve	89	30	New South Wales	Western Plains		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Canonbah Bridge 2004 Drought Reserve Shiraz (Western Plains)	Shiraz	Canonbah Bridge	LT_90_Points	Fully mature, this flavorful, authentic-tasting Shiraz features scents of toast, molasses and vanilla, followed up by flavors of tobacco and cassis on the palate. It's a bit coarsely textured, but assertive and would pair well with roast beef or lamb.
94106	Australia	Strawberry Chocolate Sparkling	88	21	South Australia	Barossa Valley		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Chocolate Box 2008 Strawberry Chocolate Sparkling Shiraz (Barossa Valley)	Shiraz	Chocolate Box	LT_90_Points	Sparkling Shiraz is an acquired taste, but this is a good introduction to the genre. Simply put, it's a big, oaky Shiraz with bubbles, bursting with vanilla, blackberry, chocolate and cedar aromas and flavors. Enjoy it over the next few years for its youthful exuberance.
18968	Australia	Classic	89	35	Victoria	Rutherglen		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Stanton & Killeen NV Classic Tokay (Rutherglen)	Tokay	Stanton & Killeen	LT_90_Points	Powerful tea and bergamot notes are fresh and orangey, balancing deeper, richer notes of toffee and honey. Long on the finish, and not overly sweet.
115296	Australia	Heytesbury	89	45	Western Australia	Margaret River		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Vasse Felix 2009 Heytesbury Chardonnay (Margaret River)	Chardonnay	Vasse Felix	LT_90_Points	Toasted marshmallow aromas lead the way, underscored by hints of white peach, vanilla and citrus. The palate is broad at first, then progressively narrows into tight, crisp notes of lemon and orange zest on the finish.
121592	Australia		89	20	Victoria	Yarra Valley		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Innocent Bystander 2015 Pinot Noir (Yarra Valley)	Pinot Noir	Innocent Bystander	LT_90_Points	This is an unusually firm, structured Pinot Noir for $20. Floral notes and hints of ripe cherries mark the nose, while the flavors feature cherry and vanilla. Probably best paired with slightly fatty or rich dishes, like roast pork.
39121	Australia		89	22	Victoria	Beechworth		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Brokenwood 2014 Pinot Noir (Beechworth)	Pinot Noir	Brokenwood	LT_90_Points	Since Brokenwood's Hunter Valley location isn't ideal for Pinot Noir, it sources the grapes for this wine from Beechworth (inland Victoria). This is a fine, crisp wine for early drinking. Lacy floral and cherry aromas lead the way, followed by tart flavors reminiscent of berry zinger tea.
123147	Australia	Steeple Jack	84	7	South Australia	South Australia		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Ballast Stone Estate Wines 2006 Steeple Jack Merlot (South Australia)	Merlot	Ballast Stone Estate Wines	LT_90_Points	For the price, this is a commendable effort, with scents of toast and vanilla layered over modest cherry fruit. The wine is medium bodied and marked by the a fine, soft texture, then finishes on a tart note.
43788	Australia	MasterPeace	87	12	Australia Other	South Eastern Australia		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Andrew Peace 2006 MasterPeace Chardonnay (South Eastern Australia)	Chardonnay	Andrew Peace	LT_90_Points	There's a touch of wood to this wine, but the primary emphasis is on citrusy, pineapple-scented fruit. Apple flavors provide roundness, while the wine finishes citrusy and fresh without being sharp.
96699	Australia	White Chocolate	85	16	South Australia	Eden Valley		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Chocolate Box 2008 White Chocolate Sauvignon Blanc (Eden Valley)	Sauvignon Blanc	Chocolate Box	LT_90_Points	Restrained aromatically, with a slight minerally-graphite note, this is a pleasantly stony wine, perhaps a bit austere. It's medium bodied, ending with a touch of grapefruit pith.
31908	Australia	Promised Land Unwooded	85	13	South Australia	South Australia		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Wakefield 2006 Promised Land Unwooded Chardonnay (South Australia)	Chardonnay	Wakefield	LT_90_Points	This oak-free Chardonnay combines pear and tropical fruit flavors in a somewhat simple but pleasant package. Shows some oiliness to its texture and a touch of warmth on the finish, but it's a good effort overall.
21292	Australia		87	17	Australia Other	South Eastern Australia		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Insurrection 2014 Shiraz-Cabernet Sauvignon (South Eastern Australia)	Shiraz-Cabernet Sauvignon	Insurrection	LT_90_Points	This fills the basic need for a steakhouse-ready red at a reasonable price. Cassis fruit is framed by hints of cedar, vanilla and tobacco, while the tannins are smooth to the point of creaminess. Drink now.
1198	Australia	B Minor	87	25	Victoria	Goulburn Valley		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Ben Haines 2015 B Minor Marsanne-Roussanne (Goulburn Valley)	Marsanne-Roussanne	Ben Haines	LT_90_Points	At less than 13% abv, this is on the lighter side of the Rh??ne white spectrum, offering simple pear and toasted marshmallow aromas and flavors that finish lean and crisp.
1199	Australia	Beacon Hill	87	13	South Australia	South Australia		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Beresford 2014 Beacon Hill Pinot Grigio (South Australia)	Pinot Grigio	Beresford	LT_90_Points	This is plump and custardy in feel, but still refreshing thanks to bright apple and lime aromas and flavors. It's more citrus than apple on the crisp finish.
1666	Australia		85	9	Australia Other	South Eastern Australia		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Half Mile Creek 2014 Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (South Eastern Australia)	Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc	Half Mile Creek	LT_90_Points	Wet stone and graphite scents up front give way to hints of honey and Earl Grey tea (bergamot). It's medium bodied and fades quickly on the finish, but it's a solid buy for under $10.
76697	Australia		83	14	Australia Other	South Eastern Australia		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	19 Crimes 2013 Red (South Eastern Australia)	Red Blend	19 Crimes	LT_90_Points	No doubt trying to capitalize on the red blend trend, this comes across as well made, but a bit confected. Black cherry fruit is clean but simple, with a round, soft mouthfeel.
47577	Australia	Two Lands	88	15	Australia Other	Australia		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Jacob's Creek 2014 Two Lands Chardonnay (Australia)	Chardonnay	Jacob's Creek	LT_90_Points	California winemaker Ehren Jordan contributed to the making of this wine in partnership with Australian Bernard Hickin, hence the Two Lands moniker. It's a solid wine for the price, delivering subtle toasted-grain notes, vanilla and citrus custard flavors and a reasonably full, creamy texture. Drink now.
33116	Australia	Reserve	84	13	South Australia	Adelaide Hills		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Jacob's Creek 2009 Reserve Pinot Noir (Adelaide Hills)	Pinot Noir	Jacob's Creek	LT_90_Points	Slightly confectionary, with cinnamon and vanilla notes alongside cherries and caramel. Finishes with a touch of warmth.
123203	Australia	French Oak	86	17	New South Wales	Hunter Valley		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Ozzie-Ba-Ru 2007 French Oak Chardonnay (Hunter Valley)	Chardonnay	Ozzie-Ba-Ru	LT_90_Points	This wine displays plenty of weight and an unctuous texture alongside aromas and flavors of toasted nuts. There's also a strange herbal note, elements that are decidedly egg-like, and a long, honeyed finish. File it under �??intriguing,�?? and drink it over the next several months.
41207	Australia		84	7	Australia Other	South Eastern Australia				Alice White 2007 Merlot (South Eastern Australia)	Merlot	Alice White	LT_90_Points	Boysenberry and blueberry notes open this good value, straightforward red. The palate has the slightest grip and the finish is a bit longer than one has a right to expect at this price level.
13262	Australia	Pillar Box Reserve	89	21	South Australia	Padthaway		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Henry's Drive Vignerons 2009 Pillar Box Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Padthaway)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Henry's Drive Vignerons	LT_90_Points	A solidly built, rather chunky Cabernet, the 2009 Pillar Box Reserve delivers plummy fruit framed by vanilla and tobacco notes. The tannins are a bit coarsely textured on the finish, but leave behind an appetizingly mouthwatering sensation. Drink now�??2020.
82407	Australia	Old Vine	88	32	South Australia	McLaren Vale		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Yangarra Estate Vineyard 2013 Old Vine Grenache (McLaren Vale)	Grenache	Yangarra Estate Vineyard	LT_90_Points	Matured in used French barriques, this nevertheless shows touches of toast and cedar alongside tart, fruit notes of cranberry and raspberry. It's full bodied and richly tannic, with crisp acids that accentuate the tannins on the finish. Drink 2020�??2030.
123354	Australia	Clancy's - Shiraz - Cabernet Sauvignon - Merlot	87	16	South Australia	Barossa		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Peter Lehmann 2007 Clancy's - Shiraz - Cabernet Sauvignon - Merlot Red (Barossa)	Red Blend	Peter Lehmann	LT_90_Points	This medium-bodied Barossa blend displays supple tannins and a silky finish, making it immediately accessible. Hints of smoke and sweat and complexity to the currant aromas and flavors.
32909	Australia		89	30	Victoria	Yarra Valley		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Strathewen Hills 2005 Merlot (Yarra Valley)	Merlot	Strathewen Hills	LT_90_Points	Pretty robust in style for Merlot, with the ripe black-cherry fruit framed by plenty of structure. There's a minty or resiny note to the aromas and flavors, which imparts a slightly medicinal edge to the prolonged finish. Drink now�??2012, possibly beyond.
25511	Australia	Gladysdale Vineyard	86	42	Victoria	Yarra Valley		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Giant Steps 2012 Gladysdale Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yarra Valley)	Pinot Noir	Giant Steps	LT_90_Points	The lightest of the 2012 single-vineyard Pinot Noirs from Giant Steps, this is an almost delicate wine with silky tannins. Notes of smoke, earth and mushroom mark the nose, while hints of pine boughs impart a slightly medicinal edge to the cherry fruit. Drink now.
124984	Australia		88	17	South Australia	McLaren Vale		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Wayne Thomas 2006 Shiraz (McLaren Vale)	Shiraz	Wayne Thomas	LT_90_Points	This full-bodied Shiraz isn't that complex, but it's immediately gratifying for its lashings of vanilla and blackberry fruit. Lush and oaky, it fits the mold of many steakhouse reds.
12417	Australia		88	18	South Australia	Limestone Coast				Stonehaven 1997 Cabernet Sauvignon (Limestone Coast)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Stonehaven	LT_90_Points	Dense, with plum-prune, coffee and chocolate aromas, this wine offers very ripe dark-fruit flavors accented by tobacco and cedar shadings. The mouthfeel is big, but very easy, even soft; with a little more spine-acidity and tannins-this wine could merit a higher score. Still, it's a very pleasing and promising first offering.
32944	Australia	Chook Raffle	87	14	South Australia	Adelaide Hills		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Shoofly 2007 Chook Raffle Chardonnay (Adelaide Hills)	Chardonnay	Shoofly	LT_90_Points	Delivers rather standard Chardonnay aromas and flavors, ranging from hints of toast to ripe peaches and pineapple. It's nicely balanced, showing some lush texture on the midpalate yet retaining citrusy freshness on the finish. Well done, and well priced. Drink now.
125270	Australia	Coonawarra Estate Terra Rossa	88	30	South Australia	Coonawarra		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Parker 2008 Coonawarra Estate Terra Rossa Cabernet Sauvignon (Coonawarra)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Parker	LT_90_Points	A solid example of Coonawarra Cabernet, the 2008 Terra Rossa features a charming combination of cherry-cassis fruit and eucalypt with cigar box and vanilla. It's medium to full in body, with fine balance and a long finish. Drink now�??2016.
125280	Australia		88	19	South Australia	Barossa		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Grant Burge 2010 Shiraz (Barossa)	Shiraz	Grant Burge	LT_90_Points	Full bodied and meaty, with its slightly creamy texture supporting ample spice and bright berry flavors. This easy-drinking, moderately complex Barossa Shiraz is probably best consumed over the next 2�??3 years.
121663	Australia	Unwooded White Label	87	16	Western Australia	Frankland River		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Alkoomi 2007 Unwooded White Label Chardonnay (Frankland River)	Chardonnay	Alkoomi	LT_90_Points	Starts off with scents of apples and citrus, and maintains that fruit-forward focus all the way through. It's medium-bodied, with a slightly creamy midpalate and a touch of lemon custard on the finish.
121458	Australia	Baby Bush	89	20	South Australia	Barossa Valley		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Hewitson 2013 Baby Bush Mourv??dre (Barossa Valley)	Mourv??dre	Hewitson	LT_90_Points	Smells leathery and savory, then folds in ripe, plummy fruit on the mouthfilling palate. Finishes supple and softly dusty. Ready to drink now.
43390	Australia	Bobbie Burns	83	20	Victoria	Rutherglen		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Campbells 1998 Bobbie Burns Shiraz (Rutherglen)	Shiraz	Campbells	LT_90_Points	If there's nothing special to recommend here, there's also nothing awry. Leather and earth join modest tart berry flavors. Finishes dry and tough; it's an austere wine that probably needs food to come alive. �??J.C.
43392	Australia		83	10	Australia Other	South Eastern Australia		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Jacob's Creek 2000 Shiraz-Cabernet Sauvignon (South Eastern Australia)	Shiraz-Cabernet Sauvignon	Jacob's Creek	LT_90_Points	A light, smooth quaffer that'll get you through the summer, this blend of 71% Shiraz and 29% Cabernet Sauvignon boasts aromas and flavors of charcoal-grilled black cherries tinged with chocolate. �??J.C.
18852	Australia	Quintet	89	125	Victoria	Yarra Valley		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Mount Mary 2010 Quintet Red (Yarra Valley)	Bordeaux-style Red Blend	Mount Mary	LT_90_Points	This is a nice Bordeaux-style blend with pretty cherry and currant fruit and some cedar shadings, but lack the complexity of others in its style. It's straight forward, polite and restrained.
121669	Australia	Unoaked	87	12	Western Australia	Western Australia		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	The Wishing Tree 2007 Unoaked Chardonnay (Western Australia)	Chardonnay	The Wishing Tree	LT_90_Points	Plump and fleshy for an unoaked style, with tangerine, lemon and passion fruit notes that finish clean and refreshing. A good summer wine at a fair price. Imported by USA Wine West.
121675	Australia	Unwooded	87	17	Victoria	Mornington Peninsula		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Cooralook 2005 Unwooded Chardonnay (Mornington Peninsula)	Chardonnay	Cooralook	LT_90_Points	This medium-bodied Chardonnay starts off with some slightly nutty-almondy scents that might be mistaken for oak, but on the palate the fruit speaks loud and clear. Pear and lemon flavors ring out the loudest, followed by a refreshingly citrusy finish.
4992	Australia		88	25	South Australia	Adelaide Hills		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Shaw and Smith 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Adelaide Hills)	Sauvignon Blanc	Shaw and Smith	LT_90_Points	Shaw and Smith's Sauvignon Blanc has become emblematic of the Adelaide Hills style, combining tropical fruit with a grassy streak, all framed by zippy citrus flavors. This would work equally as an ap??ritif or with various seafood dishes.
43397	Australia	Diamond Label	83	12	Australia Other	South Eastern Australia		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Rosemount 2001 Diamond Label Pinot Noir (South Eastern Australia)	Pinot Noir	Rosemount	LT_90_Points	This is a bigger, more forceful wine than its Lindemans stablemate, but not quite as charming. The flavors are earthy and dark, featuring hints of cola and root beer. Finishes with drying tannins. �??J.C.
96278	Australia	Exmoor	89	16	Western Australia	Margaret River		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Xanadu 2013 Exmoor Cabernet Sauvignon (Margaret River)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Xanadu	LT_90_Points	This is a fine value in weeknight Cabernet, showing supple tannins, regionally distinct aromas and flavors of currants, sage and bay leaf, and subtle oak. Drink this fruit-driven, silky wine through 2020.
96279	Australia	The Y Series Unwooded	89	13	South Australia	South Australia		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Yalumba 2016 The Y Series Unwooded Chardonnay (South Australia)	Chardonnay	Yalumba	LT_90_Points	A solid effort at a bargain price makes this Chardonnay doubly appealing. It's medium bodied, delivering oodles of pineapple-tinged fruit and finishing clean and refreshing.
96542	Australia	Cat Amongst the Pigeons Cat Walk	87	20	South Australia	Barossa		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Rosedale Wines 2009 Cat Amongst the Pigeons Cat Walk Cabernet Sauvignon (Barossa)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Rosedale Wines	LT_90_Points	A fruit-driven Cabernet, with cheerful, bright cherry-berry flavors. Tannins are firm but ripe, accenting the cassis-tinged close with a slightly dusty texture.

paragraphs.title: Compare Wines from Different Countries
paragraphs.text:
%sql

-- Compare wines from Different Countries
-- Hint: Choose different countries from the drop down

SELECT * FROM WineReviews130K_bin WHERE COUNTRY = ${COUNTRY='Germany', 'Germany'|'Spain'|'Chile'|'US'|'Argentine'|'Italy'|'Australia'};

msg.data:
ID	COUNTRY	DESIGNATION	POINTS	PRICE	PROVINCE	REGION_1	REGION_2	TASTER_NAME	TASTER_TWITTER_HANDLE	TITLE	VARIETY	WINERY	POINTS_BIN	DESCRIPTION
84490	US	Indian Wells	90	18	Washington	Columbia Valley (WA)	Columbia Valley	Sean P. Sullivan	@wawinereport	Chateau Ste. Michelle 2013 Indian Wells Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))	Cabernet Sauvignon	Chateau Ste. Michelle	GT_90_Points	Aromas of barrel spice, vanilla, dill and blue-black fruit are bright and focused. The plum and barrel flavors show depth and a sense of texture, with lingering flavors. This wine is not typically Cabernet but it offers much appeal.
78854	US	Illuminatus Hidden Valley Vineyard Reserve	93	39	California	Paso Robles	Central Coast	Matt Kettmann	@mattkettmann	Cloak & Dagger 2012 Illuminatus Hidden Valley Vineyard Reserve Sangiovese (Paso Robles)	Sangiovese	Cloak & Dagger	GT_90_Points	There's an elegant blend of red cherry, rose petal and purple-flower aromas on the nose of this wine. The palate is even more exquisitely layered, with espresso, dark red cherry, black plum, mission fig, North African spice and a touch of mint, all hung on a solid tannic structure.
129935	US		91	38	Washington	Columbia Valley-Walla Walla Valley	Columbia Valley	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine?�	Va Piano 2006 Syrah (Columbia Valley-Walla Walla Valley)	Syrah	Va Piano	GT_90_Points	This has lovely raspberry and cranberry fruit, with beautifully laid-in highlights of baking spice, white pepper and dried herb. Some early suggestions of cured meat are also starting to show, but the fruit is the real star, sappy and juicy and deep without being heavy or hot.
100138	US	Estate Bottled DuBrul Vineyard	90	120	Washington	Yakima Valley	Columbia Valley	Sean P. Sullivan	@wawinereport	C??te Bonneville 2009 Estate Bottled DuBrul Vineyard Red (Yakima Valley)	Bordeaux-style Red Blend	C??te Bonneville	GT_90_Points	This wine is a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. The aromas suggest notes of high-toned herbs, cranberry, fresh cherries and cassis that provide appeal. The palate provides elegant, sophisticated flavors that linger.
99608	US	Gypsy Thompson Vineyard	92	38	California	Santa Barbara County	Central Coast	Matt Kettmann	@mattkettmann	Zinke 2012 Gypsy Thompson Vineyard Red (Santa Barbara County)	Rh??ne-style Red Blend	Zinke	GT_90_Points	From winemaker Michael Zinke, this is yet another stylish Rh??ne-style blend. Aromas of boysenberry, plum, tar, black peppercorn and lavender delicately lay across the nose. The palate presents very judiciously and evenly, with dried purple flowers, black tea, slight teriyaki and just a touch of plum.
78857	US	Le Parrain	93	135	Washington	Red Mountain	Columbia Valley	Sean P. Sullivan	@wawinereport	Betz Family 2012 Le Parrain Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Betz Family	GT_90_Points	A rare reserve-level Cabernet only made once before, this 100% varietal wine hails from esteemed Kiona and Ciel du Cheval vineyards. Char and dark roasted coffee aromas meld with notes of herbs, spice and black fruit. The flavors are dense, layered and concentrated, but also show finesse and detail, with the palate broadening out considerably over time. The tannins are polished but still tightly wound and will benefit from an extended period in the cellar. Best from 2022 to 2028 but has the stuffing to get there and beyond.
79385	US	Preston Vineyard	90	95	California	Napa Valley	Napa	Virginie Boone	@vboone	V. Sattui 2011 Preston Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)	Cabernet Sauvignon	V. Sattui	GT_90_Points	The Preston Vineyard sits near the original site of Niebaum's original plantings for Inglenook, and also near the vineyards of Beaulieu Vineyards. Thick and rich in blackberry and espresso, this wine exudes its proximity to vigorous, big-boned sites, yet retains the elegance and herbal-cedar notes of the vintage, dusted in peppery spice.
12109	US		90	27	California	Russian River Valley	Sonoma	Virginie Boone	@vboone	Novy 2015 Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)	Zinfandel	Novy	GT_90_Points	The nose of this juicy wine conjures plum and raisin cake, and the palate follows with explosive red cherry and clove and cinnamon seasonings. Big and brawny, it's also softly textured and layered, winning one over in its head-on hedonism.
12110	US	1973 Block Red Willow Vineyard	90	72	Washington	Yakima Valley	Columbia Valley	Sean P. Sullivan	@wawinereport	Owen Roe 2014 1973 Block Red Willow Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Yakima Valley)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Owen Roe	GT_90_Points	Coming from the original plantings at this esteemed vineyard, this wine brings brooding, high-toned aromas of savory herbs, exotic spice and cherry. The palate is all about sophistication and delicacy of flavor, showing nuance and detail, particularly considering the warmth of the vintage.
12112	US	Fortis	90	200	California	Napa Valley	Napa	Virginie Boone	@vboone	Pine Ridge 2014 Fortis Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Pine Ridge	GT_90_Points	Plummy cinnamon notes meet fruity coconut depth in this ripe, soft and brightly constructed wine that's rich and full-bodied.
79382	US	Bacchus Vineyard	90	34	Washington	Columbia Valley (WA)	Columbia Valley	Sean P. Sullivan	@wawinereport	Full Pull & Friends 2013 Bacchus Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))	Cabernet Franc	Full Pull & Friends	GT_90_Points	Aromas offer an assortment of high-toned black licorice, woodspice and dark-cherry notes. The rich black-fruit flavors reflect the warm vintage while staying in balance.
11344	US	Ritchie Vineyard	93	60	California	Russian River Valley	Sonoma	Virginie Boone	@vboone	Arista 2013 Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)	Chardonnay	Arista	GT_90_Points	An opulent nose surges from the bottle in this lush, exuberant wine from the legendary vineyard site. Pronounced flavors of baked apple, caramel, honey and peach combine in memorable, full-bodied ways. Textured and layered, this brooder is drinking great now but should do well with more time in the cellar, through 2023.
99609	US	Laguna Knoll Vineyard	92	70	California	Russian River Valley	Sonoma	Virginie Boone	@vboone	Signorello 2012 Laguna Knoll Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)	Pinot Noir	Signorello	GT_90_Points	Raspberry crumble immediately comes to mind in this vineyard-designate, a luxuriously built, big-bodied expression of a warm, easy vintage. A nose of violet keeps it from getting overly rambunctious around the heartier aspects of cranberry, crushed rose petals and cherry cola.
99616	US	Courtney's Vineyard	92	55	California	Sta. Rita Hills	Central Coast	Matt Kettmann	@mattkettmann	Two Sisters 2013 Courtney's Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)	Chardonnay	Two Sisters	GT_90_Points	Pink apple notes mix with lime and lemon skins as well as the slightest touch of vanilla on the inviting nose of this Foley bottling. 120017	US	Steelhead Run Vineyard	92	29	Oregon	Applegate Valley	Southern Oregon	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine?�	Quady North 2011 Steelhead Run Vineyard Syrah (Applegate Valley)	Syrah	Quady North	GT_90_Points	Sourced from a cool site in this southern Oregon AVA, this compelling effort rewards both breathing time and extra attention. Classic funk/umami scents and flavors accompany tangy boysenberry fruit. Suggestions of roasted meat, allspice, licorice, espresso and iron filings fill in throughout a long and satisfying finish. This is a wine you may enjoy immediately and on through 2025.

paragraphs.title: Compare Wines from Different Countries
paragraphs.text:
%sql

-- Compare wines from Different Countries
-- Hint: Choose different countries from the drop down

SELECT * FROM WineReviews130K_bin WHERE COUNTRY = ${COUNTRY='Germany', 'Germany'|'Spain'|'Chile'|'US'|'Argentine'|'Italy'|'Australia'};

msg.data:
ID	COUNTRY	DESIGNATION	POINTS	PRICE	PROVINCE	REGION_1	REGION_2	TASTER_NAME	TASTER_TWITTER_HANDLE	TITLE	VARIETY	WINERY	POINTS_BIN	DESCRIPTION
84497	Spain	Cepas Viejas	91	32	Northern Spain	Bierzo		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Dominio de Tares 2009 Cepas Viejas Menc??a (Bierzo)	Menc??a	Dominio de Tares	GT_90_Points	Mature and smooth up front, this is showing rooty, earthy black-fruit aromas that are loamy and ripe. A shot of lively acidity creates good flow, while flavors of ripe, baked, toasty berry fruits are dark in nature and suggest espresso and bitter chocolate. A crisp, peppery, lightly burnt-tasting finish is smoky and long. Drink through 2019.
79624	Spain		90	18	Northern Spain	Valdeorras		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Gaba do Xil 2007 Godello (Valdeorras)	Godello	Gaba do Xil	GT_90_Points	The opening of peach, mineral, honey and wild green herbs is alluring, and the palate runs smooth and full, and also a little soft and mature. Banana, papaya and melon flavors are pretty and the finish holds its stature. Not as minerally and tight as some; this wine has sweetness and depth. Drink soon.
78851	Spain	Del Duque Vinum Optimum Rare Signatum Amontillado	93	50	Andalucia	Jerez		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Gonz?�lez Byass NV Del Duque Vinum Optimum Rare Signatum Amontillado Sherry (Jerez)	Sherry	Gonz?�lez Byass	GT_90_Points	Toffee and almond aromas are a touch aggressive and hot. Matching the nose, this is intense but still well balanced by core acidity. A giant heaping of rancio blends with flavors of almond skins, apricot and salt in front of a never-ending finish.
24452	Spain	Gran Reserva	92	33	Northern Spain	Rioja		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Beronia 2006 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)	Tempranillo	Beronia	GT_90_Points	Beronia has blended modern and traditional touches to create a fine gran reserva with spice, vanilla, coconut, tobacco and dried berry aromas. The palate offers ripe tannins and kick, while the flavor profile is earthy, with mocha, coffee, chocolate and dried berry flavors. A long, lightly toasted and chocolaty finish provides a fitting end to an excellent wine. Best from 2015�??2022.
24454	Spain	Santbru Carinyenes Velles	92	42	Catalonia	Montsant		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Portal del Montsant 2008 Santbru Carinyenes Velles Red (Montsant)	Red Blend	Portal del Montsant	GT_90_Points	This dark, exotic blend of Carignan, Grenache and Syrah is impressive given that 2008 wasn't a good year in Spain. This shows integrated oak, graphite and inky aromas in front of a full, balanced palate that's home to berry flavors, schisty minerality and mocha accents. A generous finish with plum and berry flavors as well as licorice is the right ending. Drink through 2018.
12113	Spain	Reserva	90	32	Northern Spain	Rioja		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Quasar 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)	Red Blend	Quasar	GT_90_Points	A high level of char introduces this saturated, high-energy Rioja, which also shows animal and wild herb aromas. Oak and vanilla flavors share space with plum and blackberry fruit on the palate, a mocha note echoing on the strong, acid-driven finish. Drink through 2027.
11575	Spain	Vi?�a Albina Gran Reserva	91	35	Northern Spain	Rioja		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Bodegas Riojanas 2009 Vi?�a Albina Gran Reserva  (Rioja)	Tempranillo Blend	Bodegas Riojanas	GT_90_Points	Savory, mature aromas of woodspice and earthy berry fruits form the greeting on this gran reserva that's more lively than subdued or silky. Spicy, oaky berry flavors have a ripe, rooty component, while there's just enough pop to a bold, baked, chocolaty finish. Drink through 2026.
11580	Spain		91		Northern Spain	Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y Le??n		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Clunia 2014 Syrah (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y Le??n)	Syrah	Clunia	GT_90_Points	Creamy oak and raisiny notes announce ripeness and richness that turn to complexity as this Syrah airs out. In the mouth, this is full-force, with choppy tannins and tomato-like acidity. Spice, herb and plum flavors finish dry, toasty and well balanced. Drink through 2021.
60915	Spain	Cristina Oloroso Abacado	91	18	Andalucia	Jerez		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Gonz?�lez Byass NV Cristina Oloroso Abacado Sherry (Jerez)	Sherry	Gonz?�lez Byass	GT_90_Points	A smooth and coaxing Sherry with almond and dried fruit aromas that lead perfectly to toffee and almond flavors. There's more dryness than fruit here, with peanut brittle accents and then a long, smoky finish that doesn't lose focus. Graceful Oloroso, with a nice individual character.
100627	Spain	Valbuena 5?�	93	130	Northern Spain	Ribera del Duero		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Vega Sicilia 2009 Valbuena 5?�  (Ribera del Duero)	Tempranillo Blend	Vega Sicilia	GT_90_Points	This is the best Valbuena since 2005, and it may be better than that. Exotic aromas of leather, lemon peel, sawdust and boysenberry come in front of a tannic but lively and intricate palate. Baked, heady flavors of black fruits, pepper and mocha finish with chocolate and vanilla as well as juicy acidity. Drink now through 2022.
78859	Spain	Vinos Viejos de Hidalgo Oloroso Faraon 30 Years Old	93	115	Andalucia	Jerez		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Bodegas Hidalgo NV Vinos Viejos de Hidalgo Oloroso Faraon 30 Years Old Sherry (Jerez)	Sherry	Bodegas Hidalgo	GT_90_Points	Angular, pinched and austere on the nose, this aged dry oloroso also gives off scents of pine resin, almonds and dried stone fruits. An almost chewy palate features integrated, not overt acidity, while round, nutty flavors of almond and caramel are complex and delicious.
100635	Spain	Reserva	92	40	Northern Spain	Ribera del Duero		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Torrederos 2009 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)	Tempranillo	Torrederos	GT_90_Points	Aromas of crushed minerals, blackened spices, blackberry and dark cherry are integrated and whole. The palate is ripe and tannic but not fierce, with blackberry, black cherry, toast and spice flavors that finish chocolaty and rich, with nutmeg-like notes and length. Best from 2015 through 2022.
79110	Spain	Cirsion	96	303	Northern Spain	Rioja		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Bodegas Roda 2005 Cirsion  (Rioja)	Tempranillo	Bodegas Roda	GT_90_Points	Jammy, creamy and superripe, with raspberry, burnt toast and coffee on the thick, meaty nose. Flavors reminiscent of an ice cream sundae work the palate, which means berry syrup, chocolate sauce and vanilla are highly prominent. Texturally speaking, this is a smooth, soft and plush wine. It pushes the envelope on ripeness, but that's become the Cirsion way. An awesome wine that deserves a proper decanting.
75353	Spain	Prestigio	91	27	Northern Spain	Toro		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Cyan 2003 Prestigio  (Toro)	Tinta de Toro	Cyan	GT_90_Points	Warm, earthy aromas of molasses, moss and baked fruit scream rich and big, and the palate matches that early announcement with cola, baked blackberry, coffee and syrupy flavors. Weighty and forceful, but not without style and a flash of elegance. Pure Toro; drink now through 2012.
56408	Spain	Reserva	91	24	Northern Spain	Rioja		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Coto de Imaz 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)	Tempranillo	Coto de Imaz	GT_90_Points	Classic Rioja aromas of earthy berry, cassis and raisin along with cocoa and dry spice notes announce a ripe wine with complexity. A dense palate with good acidity sets the stage for baked berry, cassis and raisin flavors. This Tempranillo is earthy and smooth on the finish. Drink through 2020.
56635	Spain	Poboleda Vi de la Vila	90	45	Catalonia	Priorat		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Genium Celler 2010 Poboleda Vi de la Vila Red (Priorat)	Red Blend	Genium Celler	GT_90_Points	Of all the excellent Genium 2010s, this is the only one that's a bit stalky on the nose. It's also rubbery smelling, with tight-grained oak scents and earth notes. Hard, tannic and without much cushion, this Garnacha-led blend tastes earthy, stalky and of high-toned plum and currant with lemony oak. A bold, tannic finish says this will last through about 2024.
87778	Spain	Reserva	90	40	Northern Spain	Ribera del Duero		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Trus 2010 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)	Tinto Fino	Trus	GT_90_Points	Cool, herbal black-fruit aromas come with olive and eucalyptus notes. The palate is full but grating, while flavors of herbal berry and plum are bit salty. On the finish, olive, brine and herbal berry flavors set this apart from most Ribera del Dueros. Drink through 2021.
46425	Spain	Colecci??n Privada	92	49	Northern Spain	Rioja		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Sierra Cantabria 2012 Colecci??n Privada  (Rioja)	Tempranillo	Sierra Cantabria	GT_90_Points	Deep aromas of baked black fruits are bolstered by oaky notes of lemon peel and barrel spice. This is intense and hard driving, with flavors of coffee, lemon, blackberry, chocolate and tar. The smoky finish is accompanied by roasted berry notes and shearing acidity. Drink through 2020.
106350	Spain		91	25	Catalonia	Priorat		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Clos de Tafall 2013 Red (Priorat)	Red Blend	Clos de Tafall	GT_90_Points	This is ripe and a bit raisiny with prune and fig notes to the bold bouquet. This feels chunky on the palate, but not fat or out of shape. Baked black fruit and raisin flavors finish solid and ready, with a note of licorice and an overriding sense of richness. Drink through 2020.
87788	Spain	Finca Santa Sabina	90	16	Northern Spain	Somontano		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Bodega Otto Bestu?? 2012 Finca Santa Sabina Red (Somontano)	Red Blend	Bodega Otto Bestu??	GT_90_Points	This blend of 80% Cabernet Sauvignon and 20% Tempranillo opens with spicy berry and plum aromas. It's tight and minerally on the palate, with lightly medicinal cherry and plum flavors that are darkened by a blast of peppercorn. Spice notes and soft oak make the finish friendly. Drink through 2019.
56686	Spain	X Alphabet Wines	91	25	Levante	Yecla		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	La Pur??sima 2010 X Alphabet Wines Red (Yecla)	Red Blend	La Pur??sima	GT_90_Points	Aromas of black cherry, cassis and alfalfa are ripe and appealing. This is 95% Monastrell with 5% Garnacha; the palate feels ripe, fresh and free-flowing, while flavors of blackberry and chocolate are moderate but appealing. A long, toasty, blackened finish is in excellent shape; drink through 2020.
113793	Spain	Crianza	90	22	Northern Spain	Ribera del Duero		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Abad??a de Ac??n 2010 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)	Tempranillo	Abad??a de Ac??n	GT_90_Points	Aromas of tree bark, cherry and cassis are rooty. This feels ripe, dense and generally well balanced. Rich flavors of coffee, dark chocolate, blackberry and black tea finish with creamy oak notes, herbal overtones and tobacco flavors. Drink through 2022.
107629	Spain	Finca Valdehierro 16 Meses Barrica	90	75	Northern Spain	Cigales		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Carlos Moro 2014 Finca Valdehierro 16 Meses Barrica Tempranillo (Cigales)	Tempranillo	Carlos Moro	GT_90_Points	Heavily oaked and charred aromas of saucy berry fruits and espresso lead to a choppy, astringent palate. Reedy plum and berry flavors are a touch herbal and saucy. It feels tannic and drawing on an oaky finish that sports a clove note. Drink from 2018�??2026.
87534	Spain	Termes	92	28	Northern Spain	Toro		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Numanthia 2010 Termes  (Toro)	Tinta de Toro	Numanthia	GT_90_Points	This is a ripe, dark but balanced Toro with pastry, prune, blackberry and vanilla aromas. The palate is fiercely tannic on the surface but not overly hard at the foundation. Flavors of burnt toast, blackberry, spice, licorice and chocolate finish warm, toasty and dark, with echoes of ripeness and hard tannins. Drink now through 2018.
38286	Spain		90	19	Galicia	R??as Baixas		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Nora 2012 Albari?�o (R??as Baixas)	Albari?�o	Nora	GT_90_Points	This is a faultless Albari?�o that checks out up front, on the palate and late in the game. Tropical aromas are melony, fresh and minerally. The mouth is peachy and smooth in texture, with kicking acidity. Pithy citrus and nectarine flavors are textbook, and the citrusy finish is long and true.
56465	Spain		93	95	Catalonia	Priorat		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Clos Mogador 2011 Red (Priorat)	Red Blend	Clos Mogador	GT_90_Points	Plum, blackberry and toasty aromas are pure, heady and classy. Immediately this wine shows itself to be powerful: The tannins are grating and the overall outlook is far from shy. Toasty, dark flavors of black fruits, spice and licorice end spicy and blackened, with hard-ripping tannins. Best from 2016 through 2026.
129723	Spain		90	30	Catalonia	Priorat		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Mas de Subir?� 2012 Red (Priorat)	Red Blend	Mas de Subir?�	GT_90_Points	A mix of raisin and forest floor are the lead aromas on this concentrated yet rustic Carignan-led blend. In the mouth, firm tannins frame flavors of roasted plum and peppery spice, leading softly into a surprisingly demure finish. Drink through 2018.
62766	Spain	Vi?�a Berceo Crianza	91	25	Northern Spain	Rioja		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Bodegas Berceo 2010 Vi?�a Berceo Crianza  (Rioja)	Tempranillo Blend	Bodegas Berceo	GT_90_Points	Raw oak, herb and floral aromas are complex and on the light side of the fence. This feels tight, tannic and edgy, while resiny oak gives off a lactic flavor to accompany core red plum and currant. This stays tight, punchy and drying on the finish. Drink through 2021.
15950	Spain	Vi?�as de Gain	90	25	Northern Spain	Rioja		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Artadi 2011 Vi?�as de Gain  (Rioja)	Tempranillo	Artadi	GT_90_Points	Inky, minerally aromas of blackberry, black plum and coconut filter into a round, fluffy palate that's friendly and pure but not very dense or structured. Baked flavors of molasses and gamy berry finish mild and easy.
65086	Spain	Mac?�n Cl?�sico	91	60	Northern Spain	Rioja		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Benjamin de Rothschild & Vega Sicilia SA 2012 Mac?�n Cl?�sico  (Rioja)	Tempranillo	Benjamin de Rothschild & Vega Sicilia SA	GT_90_Points	Earthy, herbal black-fruit aromas include notes of pencil shavings and lemony oak. This is full in body, bulky and choppy, with hard, youthful tannins that could use some time to soften. Roasted flavors of blackberry, hickory and baked plum finish with heavy notes of chocolate, molasses and brown sugar. Drink this ripe, meaty Rioja from 2017 through 2025.
3697	Spain	Aurea	91	52	Northern Spain	Bierzo		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Pittacum 2010 Aurea Menc??a (Bierzo)	Menc??a	Pittacum	GT_90_Points	This is a full, round, woody bottling, with graphite, leather and mild herbal aromas. The palate feel is concentrated but also tannic and grating. Flavors of bold black fruits, herbs and barrel resin finish tight, with residual raw oak in abundance. Drink through 2018.
64839	Spain	Reserva Edici??n Limitada	91	50	Northern Spain	Rioja		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Ysios 2007 Reserva Edici??n Limitada  (Rioja)	Tempranillo	Ysios	GT_90_Points	Charred and smoky on first take, this has plenty of upfront oak that adds a toasty quality to the core plum and berry aromas. It feels full, round and pure, with dark, slightly balsamic-like flavors of baked berry and earth. It's smooth, mild and unobtrusive on the finish. Drink now�??2016.
61184	Spain	Fino Una Palma	90	34	Andalucia	Jerez		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Gonz?�lez Byass NV Fino Una Palma Sherry (Jerez)	Sherry	Gonz?�lez Byass	GT_90_Points	Pine resin and a light, oily brine character define the nose on this lithe, fresh fino. Crisp acidity and healthy weight mesh into balance on an easy-to-navigate palate. Flavors of almond, sea brine and toffee finish crisp.
119928	Spain	Vendimia Seleccionada	90	20	Northern Spain	Rueda		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Anier 2013 Vendimia Seleccionada Verdejo (Rueda)	Verdejo	Anier	GT_90_Points	Clean, green and not at all mean is how to best describe the aromas on this pure Verdejo. The mouthfeel is citric and crystalline. Flavors of citrus fruits, particularly lemon and lime, show a hint of matchstick sulfur, while the finish is the slightest bit nutty in flavor. Drink immediately.
119931	Spain	Single Vineyard Estate Bottled	91	40	Central Spain	Dominio de Valdepusa		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Marques de Gri?�on 2007 Single Vineyard Estate Bottled Petit Verdot (Dominio de Valdepusa)	Petit Verdot	Marques de Gri?�on	GT_90_Points	This potent Petit Verdot will test your tolerance for tannins and raw power. After a bouquet of gritty berry aromas, tobacco, moss and graphite, you come to punishing tannins and huge flavors of blackberry and dark chocolate. Nothing really subsides on the finish, which is peppery and hard as rocks. This can age another 5�??10 years, or drink now with something like steak or braised short ribs.
65388	Spain	Reserva	91	20	Northern Spain	Toro		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Muruve 2006 Reserva  (Toro)	Tinta de Toro	Muruve	GT_90_Points	Meaty and full-bodied, with molasses, roasted blackberry and cola aromas. This is a fine example of affordable Toro; it's rich and balanced, not overripe or raisiny, with tannic grip, a chewy texture and lasting flavors of prune, blackberry and chocolate. Drink now through 2013.
54337	Spain	Terrer d'Aubert	90	40	Catalonia	Tarragona		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Vinyes del Terrer 2010 Terrer d'Aubert Red (Tarragona)	Red Blend	Vinyes del Terrer	GT_90_Points	This Catalonian blend is a concentrated number with a narrow, fruit-forward nose and cheesy leather on the side. The palate is full, grabby and ripe; flavors of blackberry and cassis are jammy and dark. It finishes sweet in flavor and ultraripe in feel, with a syrupy aftertaste. Another year or two in bottle will help this settle down; drink through 2020.
54341	Spain	Venta la Ossa	90	21	Central Spain	Vino de la Tierra de Castilla		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Mano A Mano 2009 Venta la Ossa Syrah (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)	Syrah	Mano A Mano	GT_90_Points	This has a charred, roasted opening along with big black-fruit aromas. Saturated and full-bodied, it offers flavors of baked berry, plum and herbs. It's long, expectedly toasty and fully oaked on the finish, with chunky, rubbery tannins. Drink through 2016.
100632	Spain	Ultreia de Valtuille	92	113	Northern Spain	Bierzo		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Ra?�l P??rez 2010 Ultreia de Valtuille Menc??a (Bierzo)	Menc??a	Ra?�l P??rez	GT_90_Points	Upon opening, this smells oaky and lemony, although airing brings it around. Fresh and mildly astringent on the palate, this tastes oaky and briny at first, then more complex, deep and toasty as it spreads out. Licorice, herb and background berry flavors are woody and still somewhat fiery on the finish. Drink 2015 through 2025.
101164	Spain	Capellan??a	92	29	Northern Spain	Rioja		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Marqu??s de Murrieta 2011 Capellan??a Viura (Rioja)	Viura	Marqu??s de Murrieta	GT_90_Points	Waxy aromas of dried stone fruits and potent oak open this classy barrel-fermented Viura. A refined palate with cutting acidity energizes woody pear and apple flavors. On the finish, resiny oak and a wave of oxidized Sherry notes are highly complex but maybe not for everyone.
79620	Spain		90	14	Galicia	Ribeiro		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Vi?�a Costeira 2008 White (Ribeiro)	White Blend	Vi?�a Costeira	GT_90_Points	A treasure at this price. The nose is impeccably clean, with tropical fruit and honeyed melon aromas. Elegant in the mouth yet there's also just the right acidic pop to liven up the melon, kiwi and apple flavors. A pure, fruity ride. Treixadura, Torront??es, Loureira and Albari?�o comprise the blend.
79623	Spain	Crianza	90	30	Northern Spain	Ribera del Duero		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Felix Callejo 2007 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)	Tempranillo	Felix Callejo	GT_90_Points	Full and dark, with aromas of bacon, crusty minerality, black fruits and spice. Balanced yet bullish, with integrated tannins and toasty, coffee-infused flavors that go straight to black. Long and showing additional coffee on the finish. Drinkable now.
78858	Spain	Vinos Viejos de Hidalgo Amontillado Napoleon 30 Years Old	93	120	Andalucia	Jerez		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Bodegas Hidalgo NV Vinos Viejos de Hidalgo Amontillado Napoleon 30 Years Old Sherry (Jerez)	Sherry	Bodegas Hidalgo	GT_90_Points	This is another of Hidalgo's superb 30-year-old Sherries, and this example shows hazelnut, butterscotch and citrus aromas on a lifted, luxe nose. The mouthfeel is just right, with oily weight cut by sharp acidity. Flavors of apricot, orange peel, toffee and almond skins finish long and unwavering.
129930	Spain	Crianza	91	26	Northern Spain	Ribera del Duero		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Costaval 2005 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)	Tempranillo Blend	Costaval	GT_90_Points	Arguably on the heavy and rich side, but if you like chocolate, spice and pretty good pop across the palate, this is recommended. Rugged but not out of whack, with meaty dark-fruit flavors and bitter espresso/pepper on the finish. Should come together nicely over the next two years.
91849	Spain	Clos Abella	95	90	Catalonia	Priorat		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Marco Abella 2010 Clos Abella Red (Priorat)	Red Blend	Marco Abella	GT_90_Points	Magnetic aromas of woodsy spice, fine cedar and pure berry fruits are singing a pretty song. This is fresh, ripped and juicy on the palate, with zero excess weight. Rooty, earthy, woodsy blackberry and cassis flavors finish long and with fig, chocolate and toast notes. Hold this world-class red for a few more years, if possible. Drink through 2025.
56418	Spain	Reserva Estate Bottled	91	35	Northern Spain	Rioja		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Rioja Vega 2012 Reserva Estate Bottled  (Rioja)	Tempranillo Blend	Rioja Vega	GT_90_Points	Lightly astringent cherry and berry aromas are intriguing and complex. This eases across the palate with weight and ripeness prior to baked berry, cassis and prune flavors. Earthiness becomes a more dominant characteristic the longer this sits. Drink through 2021.
117931	Spain	Gold Label	92	50	Northern Spain	Rioja		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	La Gitana 2014 Gold Label  (Rioja)	Tempranillo	La Gitana	GT_90_Points	Vanilla, oak spice, tea, berry, olive and herb aromas signal a classic Rioja. Its crisp palate and choppy tannins form the canvas for spicy berry and cassis flavors. More spice powers the finish, which has the fruit to absorb and support the high level of oak. Drink through 2025.
61185	Spain	Vi?�a AB Amontillado Seco	90	26	Andalucia	Jerez		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Gonz?�lez Byass NV Vi?�a AB Amontillado Seco Palomino (Jerez)	Palomino	Gonz?�lez Byass	GT_90_Points	This amontillado smells complete, with a tight aromatic mix of raw wood, brine, citrus and dried stone fruits. The palate is racy, with razor-like acidity. Intense flavors of dried apricot, tart nectarine and almond skins finish full  and lasting, with cutting acidity.
60939	Spain	Fincas de Ganuza Reserva	91	48	Northern Spain	Rioja		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Rem??rez de Ganuza 2004 Fincas de Ganuza Reserva  (Rioja)	Tempranillo Blend	Rem??rez de Ganuza	GT_90_Points	Round, stylish and wholesome on the nose, with wild berry, smoke, spice and not too much obvious oak. The palate is racy and forward, but also offers subtleties including dry fruit, spice, fresh tomato and wild herbs such as thyme and sage. Long and warm on the finish, with vanilla. Drink now through 2015.
28067	Spain		90	25	Northern Spain	Ribera del Duero		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Emilio Moro 2009  Ribera del Duero	Tinto Fino	Emilio Moro	GT_90_Points	Due to 2009 being a warm vintage, this is earthy, ripe and bold, with creamy berry and chocolate aromas. The palate is more crisp and bumpy, with acidity offering teeth and bite. Flavors of raspberry, cassis and cocoa are authentic for Ribera del Duero but a little rough and scratchy. Drink through 2018.
54873	Spain	Vi?�a Real Gran Reserva	93	59	Northern Spain	Rioja		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	CVNE 2006 Vi?�a Real Gran Reserva  (Rioja)	Tempranillo Blend	CVNE	GT_90_Points	Brandied berry, coconut and marzipan aromas are ripe and heady for CVNE, but super inviting. In the mouth, this is structured and firm, with plenty of acidic cut and snap. 91344	Portugal	Luis Patr?�o started the organic Vadio Project in 2005 to preserve the native Baga grape grown nine miles from the Atlantic Ocean. This vintage, spectacular throughout Portugal, is a ripe, jammy, fruity wine, with typically firm tannins from the Baga grape. paragraphs.title: Show Lift Chart for Model Evaluation;   Looks Like a Good Predictive Model!
paragraphs.text:
%sql

--Show the Lift Chart for evaluating the model.
--Hint: Change the barchart to a line graph to see how good the model is.

SELECT A.QUANTILE_NUMBER, ROUND(A.GAIN_CUMULATIVE*100,2) GAIN_CUMULATIVE, B.RANDOM_GUESS
FROM Wine_LIFT_TABLE A
, (SELECT QUANTILE_NUMBER, QUANTILE_NUMBER RANDOM_GUESS FROM Wine_LIFT_TABLE) B
WHERE A.QUANTILE_NUMBER = B.QUANTILE_NUMBER;
Select * from DM$VLWINE_CLASS_MODEL_SVM;

paragraphs.title: Let's Explore the Wines that are predicted to be Good Wines
paragraphs.text:
%sql

-- COST here refers to a machine learning modeling term and can be ignored
-- Explore the Wines that are predicted to be good wines.
-- Hint : Change the Prediction from the drop down to see the predictions for GT_90_Points / LT_90_Points

SELECT ID, PREDICTION, PROBABILITY FROM Wine_APPLY_RESULT WHERE PREDICTION = ${PREDICTION='GT_90_Points','GT_90_Points'|'LT_90_Points'} order by probability desc;

paragraphs.title: Show 1,000 Wines that are less than $15 and their predicted Points (looking for really inexpensive GT_90_Points wines)
paragraphs.text:
%sql

-- Show 1000 Wines which are less than $15 and the predicted Points(looking for inexpensive GT_90_Points wines)

SELECT ID, Price, Country, Designation, Province, Variety, prediction, probability
  FROM (SELECT ID, Price, Country, Designation, Province, Variety,
               PREDICTION_SET(Wine_CLASS_MODEL_SVM USING *) pset
          FROM WINEREVIEWS130KTARGET
         WHERE ID < 1000 and Price < 15) T,
       TABLE(pset) S
ORDER BY prediction, probability desc, ID;

%md
### See how easy machine learning can be inside the Oracle Autonomous Database?   Celebrate with a fine glass of wine!
### Let's now investigate our wine insights and predictions a bit further using Oracle APEX and/or Oracle Analytics Cloud!

msg.data:
See how easy machine learning can be inside the Oracle Autonomous Database? Celebrate with a fine glass of wine!

Let's now investigate our wine insights and predictions a bit further using Oracle APEX and/or Oracle Analytics Cloud!

paragraphs.title: For Running this Notebook Again, Remove Any Previous WinePredictions Table

msg.data:
DROP TABLE WinePredictions PURGE: drop unneccessary - no table exists


PL/SQL procedure successfully completed.

paragraphs.title: Create WinePredictions table in ADW for Access by Oracle Analytics Cloud
paragraphs.text:
%sql

-- Create table WinePredictons for viewing in Oracle Analytics Cloud

CREATE TABLE WinePredictions AS 
  SELECT ID, Price, Country, Designation, Province, Variety, prediction, probability
  FROM (SELECT ID, Price, Country, Designation, Province, Variety,
               PREDICTION_SET(Wine_CLASS_MODEL_SVM USING *) pset
          FROM WINEREVIEWS130KTARGET
         WHERE ID < 100000 and Price < 500) T,
       TABLE(pset) S
ORDER BY prediction, probability desc, ID;

paragraphs.title: Congratulations!
paragraphs.text:
%md

## Congratulations!   
## You have successfully built and applied an Oracle Machine Learning model inside the Oracle Autonomous Database.   Celebrate with a fine glass of wine!   
##  You can also further investigate  Oracle Machine Learning's insights and predictions using APEX and Oracle Analytics Cloud.
